meanings.definition: To firmly fix or establish something in a person's mind or habits.
meanings.sent1: Repeating the information will engraft it in your memory.
meanings.sent2: Studying regularly will engrain the facts in your mind.
meanings.sent3: Trying to remember all the details can engrain them in a fun way.
meanings.sent4: Her words about kindness engrained a sense of compassion in me.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's enthusiasm for learning really engrained the importance of education.

meanings.definition: To impress deeply or firmly in the mind or memory.
meanings.sent1: The emotional story will engrain itself in your heart.
meanings.sent2: The melody of the song engrains itself in your mind easily.
meanings.sent3: His silly dance moves will engrain in your memory for sure.
meanings.sent4: The breathtaking view from the mountain peak engrained in her mind forever.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh cookies baking can engrain memories of childhood.

meanings.definition: To cause something to become an integral part of a person's nature or character.
meanings.sent1: Practicing kindness daily will engrain it in your character.
meanings.sent2: Growing up in a loving environment can engrain empathy in a person.
meanings.sent3: His habit of telling jokes at the wrong time engrains humor in his character.
meanings.sent4: The values taught by her parents engrained a strong sense of integrity in her.
meanings.sent5: Experiencing different cultures can engrain a sense of open-mindedness in individuals.
